title: French Police Search For Shooting Suspects
teaser: The two brothers suspected in the deadly shooting at the satirical paper Charlie Hebdo in Paris are being hunted by authorities.
contentencoded:
Police have formed a security cordon around Paris, after unconfirmed reports that the two brothers suspected in yesterday’s deadly shooting at the Charlie Hebdo magazine might return to the city.

In northern France, police swarmed a gas station today, after a report that Cherif and Said Kouachi were involved in a robbery there. Police have not yet said whether the shooting death of a policewoman in southern Paris today was related to terrorism. Meanwhile, attacks were aimed at two mosques in France overnight.

Guy Lagache, news director at French TV station D8, joins Here & Now’s Robin Young with the latest.

Guest

  • Guy Lagache, news director at French TV station D8. He tweets @Guy_Lagache.
